quizzes.question: Whenever you run multiple queries:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Multiple Queries[/h1]

SQL allows to run multiple queries or commands at the same time. 

The following SQL statement selects the [b]FirstName [/b]and [b]City [/b]columns from the customers table:[code format="sql" ]SELECT [b]FirstName[/b] FROM customers;
SELECT [b]City[/b] FROM customers;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2793" width="100%"]
[img id="2794" width="100%"]
[note]Remember to end each SQL statement with a [b]semicolon [/b]to indicate that the statement is complete and ready to be interpreted.
In this tutorial, we will use [b]semicolon [/b]at the end of each SQL statement.[/note]

quizzes.question: SQL is:

answers.text: Whitespaces and line breaks are ignored
Line breaks divide a query into multiple queries

quizzes.question: Which is true about whitespaces?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Syntax Rules[/h1]

A single SQL statement can be placed on one or more text lines. In addition, multiple SQL statements can be combined on a single text line. 

White spaces and multiple lines are ignored in SQL. 
For example, the following query is absolutely correct. [code format="sql"]SELECT        City


FROM customers;[/code]
However, it is recommended to avoid unnecessary white spaces and lines.[note]Combined with proper spacing and indenting, breaking up the commands into logical lines will make your SQL statements much easier to read and maintain.[/note]
